intro: Hesperis pycnotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
